results.title: Little journey
results.creator_credit: Keith Nguyen, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Keith remembers little of his early years - separated from his parents and living with his grandparents. His father had been sent to a Re-education Camp and his mother had moved away. On his father’s release from the Camp the family was reunited and several years later they escaped from the hardships of Vietnam to seek a better life in Australia.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Keith Nguyen, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.description: Keith remembers little of his early years - separated from his parents and living with his grandparents. His father had been sent to a Re-education Camp and his mother had moved away. On his father’s release from the Camp the family was reunited and several years later they escaped from the hardships of Vietnam to seek a better life in Australia.

On his father’s release from the Camp the family was reunited and several years later they escaped from the hardships of Vietnam to seek a better life in Australia.

results.title: About my dad
results.creator_credit: Huong Duy Pham, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Like his father, Huong Duy Pham was also a soldier in the South Vietnam Army. But his family connections were to prove too dangerous and Huong eventually escaped by boat and made his way to Australia where he is now living with his wife and three sons. He dedicates this story to his father.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Huong Duy Pham, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.description: Like his father, Huong Duy Pham was also a soldier in the South Vietnam Army. results.title: I left my country
results.creator_credit: Joseph Xuan-Minh Le, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: In 1982 Joseph fled from Vietnam and its Communist regime finally arriving in Australia in 1983 as a refugee. He tells of his journey, of leaving family behind, his resettlement in Australia and how seven years later he was finally able to bring his family to Australia.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Joseph Xuan-Minh Le, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.description: In 1982 Joseph fled from Vietnam and its Communist regime finally arriving in Australia in 1983 as a refugee. He tells of his journey, of leaving family behind, his resettlement in Australia and how seven years later he was finally able to bring his family to Australia.

results.title: Gia mas (About us)
results.creator_credit: Parthena Savvidou, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: After her mother left, Parthena Savvidou and her father fled to Greece to live with Parthena’s grandparents for six years before their eventual return to Australia. This story is about Parthena’s memories of life in Greece and her special relationship with her father. A thank you from a daughter to her father.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Parthena Savvidou, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.description: After her mother left, Parthena Savvidou and her father fled to Greece to live with Parthena’s grandparents for six years before their eventual return to Australia. results.title: The Tran family
results.creator_credit: Thuy Tran, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description:
This story is dedicated to Thuy Tran’s father who suddenly found himself raising a family of six young children single-handedly when his wife unexpectedly passed away.
A brief introduction to each member of the Tran family is presented along with a personal tribute from Thuy to her father.

results.title: Yodit and I
results.creator_credit: Duaa Mahmoud, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: A tale of heroic acts of a mother’s quest to return her son safe and sound from the battlefields of East Africa in 1896. This inspiring story of Yodit, now half legend, stays alive as it is passed down from one generation to the next.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Duaa Mahmoud, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI

results.title: A Sad realisation
results.creator_credit: Vivian Tran, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: The sight of ugly bare land and the sound of heavy machinery where once stood a forest of trees are all too real for Vivian Tran to block out. Trees cannot protect themselves against being logged. A poignant story.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Vivian Tran, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
